intro: Coleonema album var. virgatum, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-white foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive appearance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. The varietal form 'virgatum' is distinguished by its more compact growth and enhanced floral display compared to the typical variety.
